channel.title: My server
channel.description:
Hey guys... I've worn every single bit of knowledge i have down to a pulp, and attempted every single thing i can think of, so now i'm asking for your opinions, and advice, on what i should do next...
so here's what's going on... I've had my server running, so i know how to get it up, it's been up for a while tbh... this past weekend i went to buy a new router, Linksys E1200, took me less then 10 minutes to get it hooked up and running.
Now, i'm not quite sure what the problem is, but my server wont run. I've successfully portforwarded, according to [url=http://www.yougetsignal.com/tools/open-ports/]http://www.yougetsignal.com/tools/open-ports/[/url] & [url=http://canyouseeme.org/]http://canyouseeme.org/[/url] i've port forwarded 43594, the generic rsps port, to my external IP address. I did it via router admin page, and via portforward.com (i payed to have it portforwarded)
so i'm pretty sure that isn't the problem...
I've also got my no-ip account registered and setup, the no-ip DUC is running, i've selected the host.
finally, i've triple checked the IP's on both my server and the client... Everything is/should be setup 100% correctly, yet for some reason when i go to login, Nothing...
Can ANYONE think of something that might be causing this issue? please, i'm desperate, i've been down for about 2 weeks now...

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

well, for one, that didn’t work. and 2: It’s not only me that cannot connect, none of my players can either…

Read full topic

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @xxifish_i_x xxifish i x
item.description:
@xxifish_i_x wrote:

hmm if its nividia then im not too sure
but try ip -> 0.0.0.0 ?
or leave balnk im nto to sure cause normaly for me 127.0.0.1 works perfectly fine

Read full topic

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

well i’ve done that and still nothing… RAGE lol…

this gets quite frustrating… I’ve never had to do that in the past, and i suppose i can understand why i’d have to/why it’d work, but it doesn’t anyways…

Read full topic

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

yes, 127.0.0.1 would i believe

Read full topic

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

I figured that’s what you were saying… Okay. Lastly, Would this solution apply to any other computers, say… on my wireless network?

Read full topic

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

When you login to your client, set the ip on YOUR client, no one elses, to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1

Read full topic

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Login to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 as your ip

Read full topic

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @veteran_god_king_ces veteran god: king cesar
item.description:
@veteran_god_king_ces wrote:

Hey guys… I’ve worn every single bit of knowledge i have down to a pulp, and attempted every single thing i can think of, so now i’m asking for your opinions, and advice, on what i should do next…

so here’s what’s going on… I’ve had my server running, so i know how to get it up, it’s been up for a while tbh… this past weekend i went to buy a new router, Linksys E1200, took me less then 10 minutes to get it hooked up and running.

Now, i’m not quite sure what the problem is, but my server wont run. I’ve successfully portforwarded, according to http://www.yougetsignal.com/tools/open-ports/ & http://canyouseeme.org/
i’ve port forwarded 43594, the generic rsps port, to my external IP address. I did it via router admin page, and via portforward.com (i payed to have it portforwarded)

so i’m pretty sure that isn’t the problem…

I’ve also got my no-ip account registered and setup, the no-ip DUC is running, i’ve selected the host.

finally, i’ve triple checked the IP’s on both my server and the client… Everything is/should be setup 100% correctly, yet for some reason when i go to login, Nothing…

Can ANYONE think of something that might be causing this issue? please, i’m desperate, i’ve been down for about 2 weeks now…
